extendedIngredients.name: italian seasoned breadcrumbs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup whole wheat Italian seasoned breadcrumbs

extendedIngredients.name: egg beaters
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 tablespoons egg whites or egg beaters

extendedIngredients.name: spinach
extendedIngredients.originalString: 5 oz frozen spinach, squeezed dry of any liquid

extendedIngredients.name: part skim mozzarella
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 oz part skim mozzarella (I used Polly-O)

extendedIngredients.name: marinara sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup pomodoro sauce or your favorite marinara sauce

recipes.title: Chicken Rollatini with Spinach alla Parmigiana

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Wash and dry cutlets, season with salt and pepper. Preheat oven to 450. Lightly spray a baking dish with non-stick spray. Combine breadcrumbs and 2 tbsp grated cheese in one bowl and 1/4 cup egg beaters or egg whites in another. Shred or finely chop 1.5 oz of mozzarella cheese andcombine with remaining grated cheese, spinach (make sure you squeeze it dry), 2 tbsp egg beaters, and ricotta cheese. Lay chicken cutlets down on a working surface and spread 2 tbsp of spinach-cheese mixture on each cutlet. Loosely roll each one and keep seam side down. Dip chicken in egg mixture, then in breadcrumbs and place seam side down in a baking dish (no toothpicks needed). Repeat with the remaining chicken. When finished, lightly spray with olive oil.Bake 25 minutes. Remove from oven, top with sauce then cheese. Bake until cheese is melted and bubbling, about 3 more minutes. Serve with additional sauce on the side and grated cheese.

steps.step: Wash and dry cutlets, season with salt and pepper. Preheat oven to 450. Lightly spray a baking dish with non-stick spray.

Combine breadcrumbs and 2 tbsp grated cheese in one bowl and 1/4 cup egg beaters or egg whites in another. Shred or finely chop 1.5 oz of mozzarella cheese andcombine with remaining grated cheese, spinach (make sure you squeeze it dry), 2 tbsp egg beaters, and ricotta cheese. Lay chicken cutlets down on a working surface and spread 2 tbsp of spinach-cheese mixture on each cutlet. Loosely roll each one and keep seam side down. Dip chicken in egg mixture, then in breadcrumbs and place seam side down in a baking dish (no toothpicks needed). Repeat with the remaining chicken. When finished, lightly spray with olive oil.
Remove from oven, top with sauce then cheese.
Bake until cheese is melted and bubbling, about 3 more minutes.
Serve with additional sauce on the side and grated cheese.
